sentences.sContent: She spread our lunch on the grass.
sentences.sCn: 她在草地上摆好了我们的午饭。

sentences.sContent: We avenged ourselves on  our enemy.
sentences.sCn: 我们向我们的敌人报仇。

sentences.sContent: ...people like Veiseh are of great interest to neuroscientists hoping to understand the way the brain records our lives...
...Normal forgetting may even be a safety mechanism to ensure our brain doesn’t become too full...
...As much as we would like to cling on to our past...
...And such research might even suggest ways for us all to relive our past with greater clarity...
...but also our ability to remain globally competitive...
...those books are a set of professional books used by English majors in our school...
...whose shelves house our most precious memories as well as our lifetime’s knowledge...
...our test driver believed the bus was going to slow or stop to allow us to merge into the traffic...
...memory is a mess of blurred and faded pictures of our lives...

trans.tranOther: belonging to or connected with us
